/install.html.title: Installing Buttons
/install.html.content:
buttons easy install works great out box can find < href="obsidian://showpluginid=buttons">community plugins obsidian

installation steps

  1. open community plugins: go settings obsidian
  2. browse click “browse” open directory
  3. search buttons: type “buttons” search bar
  4. install: “install” buttons plugin by shabegom
  5. enable: toggle switch enable plugin
that’s ! ’re ready start creating buttons

what’s new version 071

latest features:

  • < href="/usage/types/chain">chain buttons: run multiple actions sequence with one click
  • improved styling: better integration default obsidian themes
  • enhanced live preview: inline now work seamlessly preview mode
  • bug fixes: various performance improvements stability fixes

getting started

after installation have several ways create your first button:

option 1: use button maker

easiest way get started href="/maker">button maker:

  1. open command palette (ctrl/cmd + p)
  2. type “button maker” press enter
  3. fill form details
  4. click “insert button”

option 2: insert command

quick creation:

  1. open button” enter
  2. follow guided setup

option 3: write code

advanced users who prefer writing code directly:

```buttonname buttontype commandaction pin```^buttonfirst

plugin compatibility

buttons these popular plugins:

< href="obsidian://showpluginid=templaterobsidian">templater: add dynamic content date/time file information user input prompts see href="/usage/templater">templater integration

< href="obsidian://showpluginid=obsidianstylesettings">style settings: customize appearance without css href="/usage/styling">button styling

templates (core plugin): obsidian’s built templates href="/usage/types/template">template buttons

periodic notes: perfect that daily weekly monthly notes

requirements

  • obsidian: 0120 later
  • operating system: windows macos linux ios android
  • live recommended best experience
  • dependencies: standalone requiring other plugins

settings configuration

buttons doesn’t require any initial configuration immediately after installation however its behavior:

button settings visual customization custom css snippets styling setup: plan buttons ensure either:

  • obsidian’s core enabled folder configured
  • templater installed configured

troubleshooting installation

plugin appearing search: make sure plugins

installation fails: check internet connection try again also installing manually from github

buttons rendering: plugins

missing functionality: latest installed updates plugins

what’s next

once installed explore key features:

  1. < href="/usage">using learn basics using buttons
  2. < href="/usage/types">button types: discover all available types their uses
  3. < maker: master creation interface
  4. < href="/usage/inline">inline embed within content
  5. < styling: match theme
buttons transforms how interact notes making complex workflows simple clicking button basic link buttons then features like chain become more comfortable plugin

/usage.html.title: Using Buttons
/usage.html.content:
add button your note need codeblock let’s break down parts buttons piecebypiece ’d prefer learn by doing suggest trying < href="/maker">button maker

codeblocks

codeblock obsidian opens with three backticks closes backticks

```this codeblock```
can provde type after first backticks codeblocks are button:

```button codeblock```
’re using live preview when cursor moves out will render button

button arguments

specify what does supplying arguments inside there 3 required arguments:

  • name: text that displayed rendered
  • type: (command link template swap)
  • action: depending chosen action actually 
```buttonname this buttontype commandaction toggle pin```^buttontoggle
above render: clicked toggle pin command run

button id

might have noticed ^buttontoggle directly below this run all ids must start button unique

use maker id generated 10 hidden unless line besides being necessary proper functioning buttons also used reference once been defined way create then reuse throughout vault

more about different usages check these pages out:

  • < href="/usage/types">button types
  • < href="/usage/mutations">button mutations
  • < href="/usage/templater">templater buttons
  • < href="/usage/inline">inline href="/usage/styling">button styling

/maker.html.title: Button Maker
/maker.html.content:
button maker userfriendly interface creating buttons without writing code by hand ’s quickest way get started with buttons especially ’re new plugin want create quickly

opening button maker

can open maker several ways:

  1. command palette: search “button maker” “insert button”
  2. ribbon icon: click icon left sidebar ( enabled)
  3. rightclick menu: rightclick note select button”

button interface

presents all options easyuse form:

required fields

name
text displayed your button this what users will see click

button type
choose from these types:

  • < href="/usage/types/command">command: run command palette
  • < href="/usage/types/link">link: url uri
  • < href="/usage/types/calculate">calculate: perform mathematical calculations
  • < href="/usage/types/template">template: insert content template files
  • < href="/usage/types/text">text: specified content
  • < href="/usage/types/copy">copy: copy clipboard
  • < href="/usage/types/chain">chain: multiple actions sequence
  • < href="/usage/types/swap">swap: cycle through (inline only)
action
what when clicked varies based type selected

optional settings

button id
unique identifier blank one generated automatically ids must start “button” across vault

color
choose preset colors:

  • default ( color)
  • blue
  • green
  • red
  • yellow
  • purple
custom class
add custom css class advanced styling useful have snippets styling

remove after click
options removing other clicking:

  • don’t remove: stays clicking
  • remove button: removes itself specific buttons: remove their ids
replace content
replace lines specify end line numbers like [15] replace 1 5

inherit from
inherit settings another specifying its id child override parent settings

templater

creating different types

command button

  1. select “command” type
  2. choose dropdown list
  3. click button”

link “link” type
  • enter uri action field
  • choose color desired
  • click button”

    • template “template” operation:
    • append template
    • prepend template
    • new template
    • line template
  • select file dropdown
  • templates name opening method

    • text “text” operation (append prepend note line)
  • enter field
  • text method

    • chain “chain” type
  • add using “add action” button
  • each action specify:
    • action (command template etc)
    • perform
  • reorder dragging needed

    • button tips

    quick creation

    • use rapid prototyping ideas
    • generate code then customize hand needed
    • copy configurations between notes

    template selection

    • scans templates folder automatically
    • templates configured directory
    • both obsidian templater are supported

    command discovery

    • all available commands listed dropdown
    • this includes core commands
    • commands organized alphabetically easy browsing

    chain building

    • start simple 23 chains
    • test individually before combining
    • use preview verify chain logic

    custom styling

    • use field styling
    • create obsidian/snippets folder
    • combine style theme switching

    generated code

    when button” generates properly formatted codeblock:

    ```buttonname example buttontype commandaction toggle pincolor blue```^buttonexample
    always edit generation add features finetune configuration

    troubleshooting

    button doesn’t appear: make sure id that mode

    command working: matches exactly appears palette

    template found: check directory correct extension

    chain fails: ensure uses valid syntax references existing resources

    designed creation accessible everyone regardless technical experience handles formatting automatically letting focus

/usage/types.html.title: Button Types
/usage/types.html.content:
button type what supply type argument inside your codeblock this defines kind action should take when clicked

core types

< href="/usage/types/command">command

run any command from obsidian’s palette perfect triggering plugin functions core obsidian features custom commands

```buttonname toggle pintype commandaction pin```^buttonexamplecommand

< href="/usage/types/link">link

open urls uris internal links great quick access websites files other notes

```buttonname open documentationtype linkaction https://helpobsidianmd```^buttonexamplelink

< href="/usage/types/template">template

insert content template files create new notes templates works with both templates templater

```buttonname add meeting notestype append templateaction template```^buttonexampletemplate

content href="/usage/types/text">text

insert append prepend specified text content required

```buttonname task sectiontype textaction ## tasks [ ] 1 2```^buttonexampletext

< href="/usage/types/copy">copy

copy clipboard pasting elsewhere useful frequently used snippets commands templates

```buttonname copy email templatetype copyaction hellothank messagebest regards[your name]```^buttonexamplecopy

< href="/usage/types/calculate">calculate

perform mathematical calculations display results can reference numbers lines note

```buttonname calculate totaltype calculateaction 100+200+50```^buttonexamplecalculate

advanced href="/usage/types/chain">chain

execute multiple actions sequence single click combine different types complex workflows

```buttonname daily setuptype chainactions [ {"type": "command" "action": "open today's note"} "append text" "## goals"} "template" "daily template"}]```^buttonexamplechain

< href="/usage/types/swap">swap

create buttons that cycle through actions only < href="/usage/inline">inline buttons toggles multistate controls

```buttonname timertype swapswap [starttimer stoptimer]```^buttonexampleswap

choosing right type

use when:

  • want trigger existing functionality
  • need run system commands scripts
  • automate repetitive manual actions
use link websites external resources
  • specific attachments
  • ’re creating navigation buttons
    • use have premade reuse
  • dynamic generation templater
  • consistent formatting across notes
    • use simple insertion without files
  • structured quickly
  • basic href="/usage/templater">templater integration
    • use same snippets
  • transfer between applications
  • build library text
    • use perform math operations notes
  • content
  • ’re tracking numerical data requires computation
    • use chain sequence
  • workflows
  • one click
    • use swap functionality (/ show/hide)
  • states
  • interactive controls within content
    • each enhanced href="/usage/mutations">mutations removing buttons replacing content advanced behaviors also them href="/usage/templater">templater dynamic contextaware functionality

/usage/inline.html.title: Inline Buttons
/usage/inline.html.content:
inline buttons let place buttons directly within text paragraphs lists other content they’re created by referencing existing button codeblocks using their ids making easy reuse throughout your vault

creating inline buttons

step 1: create codeblock

first regular with unique id:

```buttonname open daily notetype commandaction periodic notes: today's note```^buttondaily

step 2: reference inline

use id backticks button:

check out tasks: `buttondaily`
this creates: check today’s

inline syntax

button requirements:

  • inline ids must start button
  • example: buttondaily buttonsave buttonexport
  • other references only need part: daily save export
inline syntax:

`button[yourid]`

multiple buttons

can multiple same line paragraph:

quick actions: `buttonsave` `buttonexport` `buttonarchive`
this creates side quick access

using different contexts

lists

 morning routine `buttonmorning` work tasks `buttonwork` evening review `buttonevening`

tables

| project | status action |||||| website progress `buttonupdatesite` || app planning `buttonplanapp` docs complete `buttonarchivedocs` |

callouts

> [!tip] actions> update note `buttondailyupdate`> want new project `buttonnewproject`

within sentences

when 're ready begin click `buttonstart` workflow will begin automatically

advanced examples

navigation menu

create navigation section buttons:

## navigation`buttonhome` `buttonprojects` `buttonarchive` `buttonsettings`

task management

**today's focus:** emails `buttonemailreview` `buttonstatusupdate` prepare meeting notes `buttonmeetingprep`

template shortcuts

**templates:** `buttonmeeting` `buttonproject` `buttondaily` `buttonweekly`

inline features

live preview support

inline perfectly live mode when move cursor away from reference renders clickable button

same functionality

inline have exactly functionality source codeblock buttons:

  • all types (command link template text etc)
  • < href="/usage/mutations">button mutations (remove replace)
  • < href="/usage/templater">templater integration works
  • custom styling colors apply

reusability

once codeblock anywhere vault:

  • same note locations
  • different entirely
  • multiple vaults ( copy codeblock)

creating commands

insert command

  1. place where button
  2. run “insert button” command palette
  3. select vault
  4. inserted automatically
this faster than typing manually

best practices buttons

organization strategies

centralized library: dedicated note all codeblocks then them vault

# library```buttonname note(quick note) textaction # <% tpdatenow() %>## notestemplater true```^buttonquicknote```button name archive completedtype file another folder```^buttonarchive# usage examplesuse `buttonquicknote` rapid creationuse clean completed tasks
contextspecific buttons: most relevant related sections

naming conventions

  • use descriptive ids: buttonmeetingsetup button1
  • group buttons: buttonprojectstart buttonprojectupdate buttonprojectcomplete
  • keep short meaningful: buttonsave buttonsavecurrentdocument

performance tips

  • inline are lightweight don’t slow down rendering
  • many without performance issues
  • button processed once regardless how exist

troubleshooting buttons

button doesn’t render: that starts button matches exactly

wrong appears: ensure across vault

button found: verify exists correct id

styling issues: make sure any custom classes defined reference

inline incredibly powerful creating clean functional interfaces notes they maintain power while keeping content readable organized

/usage/mutations.html.title: Button Mutations
/usage/mutations.html.content:
mutations are additional arguments added button modify note
button

mutations available are:

  • < href="/usage/mutations/replace">replace
  • < href="/usage/mutations/remove">remove
  • < href="/usage/mutations/swap">swap

/usage/styling.html.title: Button Styling
/usage/styling.html.content:
button styling lets customize appearance your buttons using built colors custom css classes style settings plugin can create that match theme stand out specific purposes

built color options

buttons come with several predefined options:

default colors

```buttonname default buttontype commandaction toggle pin```^buttondefault
```buttonname blue pincolor blue```^buttonblue
```buttonname green green```^buttongreen
```buttonname red red```^buttonred
```buttonname yellow yellow```^buttonyellow
```buttonname purple purple```^buttonpurple

style plugin integration

easiest way button through style settings plugin:

  1. install from community plugins
  2. go settings
  3. find “buttons” section
  4. customize styles:
    • background colors
    • text colors
    • border styles
    • hover effects
    • font sizes weights

style options

  • default color: set base all buttons
  • button border width: adjust thickness
  • button radius: control corner rounding
  • button padding: internal spacing
  • hover effects: enable/disable hover animations
  • shadow add depth shadows

custom classes

advanced styling use class argument apply css:

```buttonname styled pinclass custombutton```^buttoncustom

creating classes

create snippet obsidian/snippets/ folder:

buttonscustomcss:

/* styling */custombutton { background: lineargradient(45deg #ff6b6b #4ecdc4); color: white; border: none; borderradius: 25px; padding: 12px 24px; fontweight: bold; boxshadow: 0 4px 15px rgba(00002); transition: transform 03s ease;}custombutton:hover transform: translatey(2px); 6px 20px rgba(00003);}/* urgent */urgentbutton #ff4757; 2px solid #ff3742; 8px; animation: pulse 2s infinite;}@keyframes 0% { rgba(255 71 87 07); } 70% 10px 0); 100% }}/* success */successbutton #2ed573; 6px; 20px;}successbutton:hover #1e8449;}

using classes

```buttonname tasktype urgentbutton```^buttonurgent
```buttonname complete projecttype successbutton```^buttonsuccess

combining colors classes

combine classes:

```buttonname important actiontype redclass extrapadding```^buttoncombined
css extra padding:

extrapadding 30px; fontsize: 16px;}

themeresponsive styling

create adapt light/dark themes:

button categories styling

organize by purpose consistent styling:

navigation buttons

navbutton var(interactiveaccent); var(textaccent); 20px; 8px 16px; margin: 2px;}
```buttonname hometype navigate homeclass navbutton```^buttonnavhome

action class="languagecss">actionbutton transparent; var(textaccent); 4px; 600;}actionbutton:hover var(backgroundprimary);}

warning class="languagecss">warningbutton #f39c12; bold;}warningbutton:hover #e67e22;}

advanced examples

icon class="languagecss">iconbutton 10px; 50%; width: 40px; height: display: flex; alignitems: center; justifycontent: center;}iconbutton:hover var(backgroundmodifierhover);}

minimal class="languagecss">minimalbutton var(textmuted); 12px; 14px;}minimalbutton:hover var(backgroundmodifierhover);}

cardstyle class="languagecss">cardbutton var(backgroundprimary); var(backgroundmodifierborder); 16px rgba(00001); textalign: left; block; 100%;}cardbutton:hover translatey(1px); rgba(000015);}

css variables reference

use obsidian’s consistency:

  • backgroundprimary: main background color
  • backgroundsecondary: secondary background
  • textnormal: primary text color
  • textmuted: muted color
  • textaccent: accent color
  • interactiveaccent: interactive elements
  • backgroundmodifierborder: color
  • backgroundmodifierhover: background

styling tips

  1. test both themes: always check compatibility
  2. use variables: ensures compatibility different themes
  3. keep readable: don’t sacrifice legibility style
  4. consistent: similar types
  5. performance: avoid complex animations frequentlyused buttons

troubleshooting styling

custom styles applying: enabled snippets

colors look wrong instead hardcoded colors

buttons overlap cramped: padding margins css

hover effects working: ensure ’re correct selectors pseudoclasses

button gives over visual presentation buttons allowing interfaces perfectly workflow aesthetic preferences

/usage/types/calculate.html.title: Calculate Buttons
/usage/types/calculate.html.content:
calculate buttons let perform mathematical operations display results directly your note can simple math reference numbers from other lines note even use natural language math expressions

simple math

basic calculations with calculate button:

```buttonname add em type calculateaction 2+2```^buttonadd
when clicked this button will replace itself result: 4

referencing line numbers

calculate buttons specific note using $line syntax:

bananas have: 5 bananas lost: 3```buttonname how many bananas lefttype $1$2color yellow```^buttonbananas
$1 references number 1 (5) $2 2 (3) result 2

natural math

calculate understand expressions:

5 dogs plus cats divided by people```buttonname who gets petstype $1class petbutton```^buttonpets
this evaluate return 35

advanced examples

budget calculator

income: 3000rent: 1200 groceries: 400utilities: 200```buttonname remaining budgettype $1$2$3$4color green```^buttonbudget

percentage calculator

total points: 850points earned: 765```buttonname grade percentagetype action ($2/$1)*100color blue```^buttongrade

time calculation

start time: 95end 1725```buttonname hours workedtype $2$1```^buttonhours

supported operations

calculate < href="https://githubcom/bugwheels94/mathexpressionevaluator">mathexpressionevaluator library supporting:

  • basic operations: + * /
  • parentheses: (2 + 3) * 4
  • exponents: 2^3 2**3
  • square root: sqrt(16)
  • absolute value: abs(5)
  • trigonometric functions: sin() cos() tan()
  • logarithms: log() ln()
  • constants: pi e

complex calculation example

radius: 5```buttonname circle areatype pi ($1^2)```^buttoncirclearea

line tips

  1. line counting: are counted top starting 1
  2. multiple numbers: multiple numbers uses first one
  3. decimal both integers decimals work fine
  4. empty lines: empty still count numbering
  5. nonnumeric without treated 0

example mixed content

project budget analysistotal: 5000spent marketing: 1500remaining development: unknown```buttonname development $2$3```^buttondevbudget

styling buttons

style just like any totaltype 100+200+300color purpleclass mathbutton```^buttonstyledcalc

common cases

  • budget tracking: funds percentages
  • grade calculations: gpa test score averages
  • time worked project duration
  • unit conversions: conversion factors
  • statistics: averages sums differences
  • project planning: resource allocation timeline calculations
calculate perfect scenario where need quick embedded notes they’re especially useful dashboards notes document ’re tracking numerical data

/usage/types/chain.html.title: Chain Buttons
/usage/types/chain.html.content:
chain button allows run multiple actions sequence with single click each action can any supported button type (command text template link calculate copy even another chain) this perfect creating complex workflows that automate steps once

basic chain button

```buttonname daily setuptype chainactions [ {"type": "command" "action": "periodic notes: open today's note"} "append text" "## tasks today"} "template" "daily task template"}]```^buttondailysetup
when clicked will:

  1. open today’s note
  2. append “## today” your template

chain syntax

actions field must valid json array objects object requires:

  • type: perform
  • action: what should (varies by type)

supported types

command actions:

{"type": "toggle pin"}
text new section"}{"type": "prepend "priority: high"}{"type": "line(1) "updated: today"}{"type": "note(meeting notes) "agenda items go here"}template template" "meeting template"}{"type": "header "note(new project) "project template"}link "link" "https://obsidianmd"}{"type": "obsidian://showpluginid=buttons"}calculate "calculate" "2+2"}{"type": "$1+$2"}

advanced examples

project setup chain

this creates project note sets basic structure:

```buttonname "note(project untitled split) template"} goals"} tasks"} resources"} "focus pane right"}]```^buttonprojectsetup

weekly review chain

automate weekly process:

```buttonname reviewtype week's "weekly next planning template"}]```^buttonweeklyreview

research chain

create research metadata notetype actions "note(research topic tab) "research "created:: [[<% tpdatenow() %>]]"} summary"} key points"} references"}]```^buttonresearchnote

using buttons < href="/usage/templater">templater

use templater commands within dynamic content:

```buttonname timestamped entrytype chaintemplater trueactions <% tpdatenow('yyyymmdd hh:mm') %>"} log template"}]```^buttontimestamped

tips buttons

  1. order matters: execute from top bottom
  2. json formatting: json
  3. error handling: one fails rest will still attempt run
  4. testing: start simple chains build complexity gradually
  5. performance: very long might feel slow consider breaking them

creating buttons

using href="/maker">button maker:

  1. select “chain” type
  2. add one specifying each
  3. maker generate proper formatting
writing hand:

  • use validator into formatting issues
  • each needs both type action fields
  • remember escape quotes inside strings needed
chain are incredibly powerful automating workflows gradually more sophisticated automation get comfortable syntax

/usage/types/copy.html.title: Copy Buttons
/usage/types/copy.html.content:
copy buttons let quickly copy text your clipboard they’re perfect copying frequently used snippets commands urls any other need paste elsewhere

basic button

```buttonname email templatetype copyaction hello hope this message finds well wanted follow our previous conversation aboutbest regards[your name]```^buttoncopyemail
when clicked button copies template clipboard ready into application

copy examples

copy code snippets

```buttonname css resettype * { margin: 0; padding: boxsizing: borderbox;}```^buttoncopycss

copy meeting link

```buttonname zoom linktype https://zoomus/j/1234567890pwd=examplecolor blue```^buttoncopyzoom

copy command line instructions

```buttonname git commandstype add git commit m "update documentation" git push origin main```^buttoncopygit

copy contact information

```buttonname infotype john smithphone: (555) 1234567email: johnsmith@examplecomlinkedin: linkedincom//johnsmith```^buttoncopycontact

advanced markdown templates

```buttonname notes # [date]**attendees:** **date:** **time:** ## agenda1 2 3 discussion## action items [ ] next meeting**date:** ```^buttoncopymeetingtemplate

copy social media post

```buttonname twitter posttype  just published new blog post about productivity tips! key takeaways: use timeblocking limit notifications  take regular breakswhat's best tip #productivity #tips #workflow```^buttoncopysocial

copy multiline block

```buttonname python functiontype def calculate_average(numbers): """calculate average list numbers""" numbers: return 0 sum(numbers) / len(numbers)# example usagescores = [85 92 78 96 88]average calculate_average(scores)print(f"average score: {average}")```^buttoncopypython

using buttons with < href="/usage/templater">templater

make dynamic templater commands:

```buttonname today's datetype <% tpdatenow("yyyymmdd") %>templater true```^buttoncopydate

copy notes

```buttonname notestype tpdatenow("mmmm yyyy") %>**date:** %>**time:** tpdatenow("h:mm ") %>## agenda## itemstemplater true```^buttoncopydynamicmeeting

copy current file name

```button name referencetype [[<% tpfiletitle %>]] referenced true```^buttoncopyfileref

copy features

multiline support

copy preserve breaks formatting exactly written field

special characters

all special characters are copied correctly:

  • unicode characters:
  • symbols: @#$%^&*()
  • emoji:

markdown formatting

copy work great syntax:

  • headers: # ## ###
  • lists: 1
  • links: [text](url)
  • code: `code` blocks
  • bold/italic: **bold** *italic*

styling buttons

customize colors classes:

```buttonname important notetype  important: please review attached documents before meetingcolor redclass importantcopy```^buttoncopyimportant

common cases

development:

  • code snippets boilerplate
  • git commands workflows
  • api endpoints configurations
  • terminal commands
communication:

  • email templates signatures
  • meeting agendas templates
  • social templates
  • contact information
documentation:

  • markdown templates
  • table structures
  • reference formats
  • citation templates
personal productivity:

  • daily/weekly templates
  • project planning structures
  • habit tracking formats
  • goal setting templates

tips buttons

  1. test content: click verify correctly
  2. format destination: consider where ’ll content
  3. use templater: elements like dates names
  4. visual feedback: distinguish different types buttons
  5. organization: group related dedicated sections
copy incredibly useful streamlining repetitive tasks ensuring consistency snippets anyone who pastes similar content across applications contexts

/usage/types/text.html.title: Text Buttons
/usage/types/text.html.content:
text buttons let quickly insert prepend append create new notes with specified text content unlike < href="/usage/types/template">template buttons which use template files buttons work directly specify button

text button types

append text

add end your current note:

```buttonname add meeting sectiontype append textaction ## notes```^buttonappendmeeting

prepend beginning priority flagtype prepend high priority```^buttonprependpriority

insert specific line

insert line number:

```buttonname status toptype line(1) status: progress```^buttonlinestatus

create note text

create containing text:

```buttonname quick notetype note(quick meeting) agenda topic 1 2## action items [ ] task 2```^buttonnewmeeting

advanced options

new split pane

create open pane:

```buttonname project (split)type note(new project split) action # name## overview## goals## next steps```^buttonprojectsplit

new tab

create tab:

```buttonname daily journal (tab)type note(journal entry tab) date## wins## challenges ## tomorrow's focus```^buttonjournaltab

replace content lines

use replace argument replace existing content:

status: unknownprogress: 0%```buttonname update statustype completedreplace [12]```^buttonupdatestatus

using href="/usage/templater">templater

combine templater dynamic content:

```buttonname timestamptype <% tpdatenow("yyyymmdd hh:mm") %>templater true```^buttontimestamp

dynamic creation

```buttonname note(<% tpdatenow("yyyymmdd") %> daily) tpdatenow("dddd mmmm yyyy") %>## today's goals notes## reflectiontemplater true```^buttondailydynamic

practical examples

quick log entry

```buttonname entrytype **<% tpdatenow("hh:mm") %>** templater true```^buttonlog

add section divider

```buttonname breaktype ## section```^buttondivider

insert code block template

```buttonname blocktype ```javascript// here``````^buttoncodeblock

task list starter

```buttonname listtype tasks 2 3```^buttontasks

meeting setuptype %>**attendees:** **date:** tpdatenow("mmmm %>**time:** tpdatenow("h:mm ") agenda## discussion## itemstemplater true```^buttonmeetingsetup

text features

multiline support

text support multiline each becomes inserted text

markdown formatting

all markdown formatting preserved:

  • bold italic text
  • headers (## ### etc)
  • lists ( * numbered)
  • links [text](url)
  • code blocks inline code

special characters

text handle special characters correctly:

  • emoji:
  • symbols:
  • unicode characters

combining href="/usage/mutations">button mutations

remove after use

```buttonname onetime setup completeremove true```^buttononetime

remove multiple buttons

```buttonname finalize documenttype document finalized tpdatenow() %>remove [draft review edit]templater true```^buttonfinalize

tips buttons

  1. line breaks: actual breaks text
  2. templater integration: templater true content
  3. positioning: line(number) precise placement
  4. new options: choose between same tab split tab
  5. content replacement: replace [startend] content
text are perfect inserting frequently used patterns creating structured notes building reusable snippets they’re especially powerful when combined dynamic contextaware insertion

/usage/types/command.html.title: Command Buttons
/usage/types/command.html.content:
command button will run specified palette when clicked action argument name want run:

```buttonname toggle pin buttontype commandaction pin```^buttontoggle
```buttonname new excalidrawtype excalidraw: create drawing pane```^buttondrawing
```buttonname bouncetype hover editor: bouncing popovers```^buttonbounce

/contact/.title: Send a message
/contact/.content: can use < href="https://wwwnetlifycom/docs/formhandling/">netlify forms create contact forms like this one any other custom may wish create all submissions are sent directly your netlify dashboard (with optional notifications) utilize netlify’s native spam filter will display captcha flagged submissions

/.title: Buttons Loves you
/.content:
this documentation site amazing super popular < href="https://obisidianmd">obsidian plugin href="https://githubcom/shabegom/buttons">buttons
right now pretty empty want help fill out contact shabegom omg discord

with buttons can add codeblocks into your obsidian notes that will render clickable element ( button) used href="/usage/types/command">run any command appears palette href="/usage/types/link">open link (including deep links) href="/usage/types/template">run templater templates

button codeblock looks like this:

```buttonname buttontype commandaction toggle pin```^buttonsuper
renders this:

clicking run toggle pin

also inline create then reference using block id:

`buttonsuper`
get started quickly making there href="/maker">button maker walk through creation stepbystep

there are some advanced feautures like:

  • < href="/usage/mutations">button mutations
  • < href="/templater">templater inside buttons

issues

face issue please head href="https://discordcom/invite/obsidianmd">omg discord ping @shabegom #plugingeneral channel discord isn’t thing could ask href="https://forumobsidianmd/">obisidan forums

please don’t file issues github unless problem bug itself

/usage/types/link.html.title: Link Buttons
/usage/types/link.html.content:
link button will open specified when clicked action argument url/uri want open:

url your default browser:

```buttonname shabeblogtype linkaction https://shbgmca/blog/home```
can also use obsidian uri note:

```buttonname home notetype obsidian://openvault=myvault&file=home ```
run any other deep / xcallback url:

```buttonname hooktype hook://file/jwcto1rmvp=c2ftbw9ycmlzb24vrg93bmxvywrz&n=dankpng```

/usage/template.html.title: Template Buttons
/usage/template.html.content:
could create following template button append current time:

```buttonname timetype templateaction time```
template type works little differently from command link additional syntax specify how would like applied:

append/prepend

type template will add note specified action directly below (below id with space) this also great use your performs action doesn’t actually any content note

```buttonname time```
type prepend above botton

```buttonname time```

line

type line(start end) insert start/end lines active time line 1type line(1) time```

note

type note(title open) new provided title optionally open created note

title should unique follow title specifications obsidian notes have that generates titles every click < href="/templater">check out using templater inside codeblock

there are variety options open:

  • vsplit: open vertical split
  • hsplit: horizontal split
  • tab: tab
  • same: same window replacing currently note
  • window: window
  • false: don’t newly note
create titled time note tab:

```buttonname note(time note tab) time```
create today’s date window:

```buttonname note(<% tpdatenow() %> same) time```

template buttons + mutations

template can become even more powerful combined href="/usage/mutations/replace">replace mutation combo remove section then type location

```buttonname weathertype line(10 15) weatherreplace [1015]```

/usage/templater.html.title: Templater + Buttons
/usage/templater.html.content:
templater integration allows include dynamic templater commands within your buttons when button with templater true clicked are processed converted their values then back future use

basic integration

add any enable command processing:

```buttonname add current timetype append textaction time: <% tpdatenow("hh:mm:ss") %>templater true```^buttoncurrenttime
when this will:

    get time (eg “14:30:15”)
  1. append “current 14:30:15” note
  2. convert next use

dynamic note creation

timebased titles

```buttonname hourly logtype note(<% tpdatenow("hh:mm") %> log) ## log entry tpdatenow("yyyymmdd hh:mm") %>### notestemplater true```^buttonhourlylog

daily creation

```buttonname create daily notetype tpdatenow("yyyymmdd") daily) templateaction templatetemplater true```^buttondailynote

project notes date

```buttonname new project note(project %> split) # started tpdatenow("mmmm yyyy") %>## overview## goals## timelinetemplater true```^buttonprojectnote

text insertion templater

dynamic text append

```buttonname meetingtype **meeting %>**attendees: topics discussed:action items:templater true```^buttonmeetinglog

prepend metadata

```buttonname metadata headertype prepend created: %>modified: %>tags: []templater true```^buttonmetadata

line replacement time

```buttonname update status linetype line(1) status: updated %>replace [11]templater true```^buttonupdatestatus

template buttons template selection

```buttonname weekly review type note(weekly tpdatenow("yyyy[w]ww") %>) true```^buttonweeklyreview

monthly planning

```buttonname monthly planningtype tpdatenow("yyyymm") planning tab) action true```^buttonmonthly

advanced examples

contextaware buttons

```buttonname reference filetype referenced from: [[<% tpfiletitle %>]] true```^buttonreference

dynamic file paths

```buttonname subnotetype tpfilefolder() %>/<% details) details %>created: tpdatenow() %>parent: %>]]## contenttemplater true```^buttonsubnote

conditional content

```buttonname weekday tpdatenow("dddd") %><%* (tpdatenow("dddd") === "monday") { %>### goals [ ] goal 1 2<%* } today's taskstemplater true```^buttonweekdaylog

chain templater

chain fully support integration:

```buttonname workflowtype chaintemplater trueactions [ {"type": "note(<% tpdatenow('yyyymmdd') daily template" "action": "daily template"} "append text" "created: tpdatenow('hh:mm') %>"} "command" "focus pane right"}]```^buttondailyworkflow

templater examples

date functions

    date/time formatted date time day week tomorrow’s yesterday’s date

file name folder path full size

system monday user input prompt clipboard contents

how work

  1. before click: contains commands

  2. during processed

    action: meeting 20240719
  3. after restored use

this means each click processes fresh content while preserving use

best practices

format consistency

use consistent date formats throughout vault:

  • yyyymmdd dates
  • hh:mm times
  • yyyymmdd hh:mm timestamps

error handling

test regular templates before using them buttons:

  • verify syntax correct
  • check that functions available
  • test edge cases (weekends month boundaries etc)

performance considerations

  • complex scripts may slow execution
  • test performance typical use patterns
  • consider breaking complex operations into multiple buttons

templater requirements

buttons:

  1. install plugin
  2. enable community plugins
  3. configure settings
  4. add configuration

troubleshooting

templater processing: ensure plugin installed enabled

syntax errors: test first

date formatting issues: check documentation correct format strings

button reverts incorrectly: verify there conflicting characters commands

templater integration makes incredibly powerful creating dynamic contextaware workflows adapt environment needs

/usage/mutations/remove.html.title: Remove Mutation
/usage/mutations/remove.html.content:
remove mutations let automatically remove buttons after they’re clicked this perfect onetime actions cleanup tasks workflows where should disappear once their purpose complete

basic functionality

remove self click

add remove true make button itself clicking:

```buttonname setuptype append textaction ## project setup complete remove true```^buttononetime
after clicking will text then from note

removing multiple buttons

remove specific by id

use array ids buttons:

```buttonname start projecttype started!remove [setup config init]```^buttonstartproject
this removes with setup config init when clicked

remove others

combine true clicked plus others:

```buttonname finalize documenttype document finalizedremove [true draft review edit]```^buttonfinalize

practical examples

daily note workflow

create temporary that setting your daily note:

```buttonname morning prepend templateaction templateremove true```^buttonmorningsetup
```buttonname add taskstype today's tasks [ ] review emails team meeting workremove [morningsetup eveningsetup]```^buttonaddtasks
```buttonname evening true```^buttoneveningsetup

project workflow buttons

create sequence clean progress:

```buttonname initialize note(new project) true```^buttoninitproject
```buttonname completetype phase ready development phaseremove [initproject configproject]```^buttonsetupcomplete
```buttonname configure config [initproject]```^buttonconfigproject

weekly planning cleanup

remove making decisions:

```buttonname monday focustype [mon tue wed thu fri planning]```^buttonmon
```buttonname tuesday planning]```^buttontue
```buttonname cancel planningtype removeremove fri]```^buttonplanning

remove different types

command buttons

```buttonname open settings (one time)type commandaction settingsremove true```^buttonsettingsonce

link visit documentationtype linkaction https://helpobsidianmdremove true```^buttondocsonce

template create meeting notetype note(team meeting) [meetingprep agendasetup]```^buttonmeetingnote

chain remove

```buttonname workflowtype chainremove trueactions [ {"type": "append text" "action": "## complete"} "command" "move file another folder"} "remove" "[task1 task2 task3]"}]```^buttoncompleteworkflow

advanced patterns

conditional removal

create others based action taken:

```buttonname accept proposaltype proposal accepted moving forward implementationremove [accept reject review]```^buttonaccept
```buttonname reject rejected looking alternativesremove review]```^buttonreject
```buttonname request reviewtype under reviewwaiting feedbackremove [review]```^buttonreview

progressive removal

remove steps process:

```buttonname step 1: 1 complete: [step1]```^buttonstep1
```buttonname 2: designtype 2 design [step2]```^buttonstep2
```buttonname 3: implementationtype 3 implementation [step3 allcomplete]```^buttonstep3
```buttonname mark all complete! remove [step1 step2 step3]```^buttonallcomplete

remove < href="/usage/inline">inline buttons

remove functionality works inline too:

daily actions: `buttonmorning` `buttonafternoon` `buttonevening````buttonname routinetype completeremove [morning afternoon evening]```^buttonmorning```buttonname afternoon worktype action [afternoon evening]```^buttonafternoon```buttonname wraptype day true```^buttonevening

remove best practices

planning removal strategy

  • selfremoving buttons: use actions
  • group removal: mutually exclusive choices
  • progressive stepbystep workflows
  • cleanup clear completed buttons

button id management

  • use descriptive ’ll reference
  • group related similar prefixes
  • keep mental map which which

user experience

  • make disappear
  • don’t users might need again
  • consider using href="/usage/styling">button styling indicate buttons

troubleshooting remove

button removing: check exists matches exactly (casesensitive)

wrong removed: verify are correct

remove working affects original codeblock reference

undo removed unfortunately can’t undone recreate them manually

remove mutations powerful creating clean progressive serve get out way keeping notes uncluttered focused current actions

/usage/mutations/replace.html.title: Replace Mutation
/usage/mutations/replace.html.content:
replace mutations let remove specific lines from your note when button clicked this perfect updating dynamic content replacing outdated information clearing sections that will regenerated by templates

basic replace functionality

replace lines

use replace [startline endline] clicked:

status: unknownprogress: 0%```buttonname update status type line(1) textaction status: completereplace [12]```^buttonupdatestatus
this will:

  1. remove 12 (“status: unknown” “progress: 0%”)
  2. insert “status: complete” line 1

replace with template buttons

update weather section

## weathercurrent: unknownforecast: unknownlast updated: never```buttonname weathertype prepend templateaction templatereplace [24]```^buttonweather
this replaces data (lines 24) fresh content template

replace meeting notes

# notesattendees: tbdtopics: tbdaction items: tbd```buttonname load templatetype action [24]```^buttonmeetingtemplate

replace text line

project planning```buttonname mark progresstype project progressreplace [11]```^buttonprogress

replace task list

## today's tasks [ ] old 1 2 3```buttonname new listtype append ## review emails team meeting code reviewreplace [24]```^buttonnewtasks

dynamic < href="/usage/templater">templater

update timestamp section

last modified: nevercurrent time: unknown```buttonname timestamptype last <% tpdatenow("yyyymmdd hh:mm") %>replace [12]templater true```^buttontimestamp

replace daily planning

# plan date## goals tbd## schedule generate plantype # tpdatenow("yyyymmdd") %>## complete milestone feedback## schedule 09:00 standup 10:30 deep work session 14:00 client meetingreplace [16]templater true```^buttondailyplan

advanced patterns

replace multiple sections

## infoname: tbdstatus: unknownowner: unassigned## timelinestart: tbdend: tbdmilestones: none```buttonname initialize projecttype init replace [24]```^buttoninitproject```buttonname set timelinetype line(7) timeline [79]```^buttonsettimeline

conditional replace

current mode: development```buttonname switch productiontype current productionreplace [11]```^buttonproduction```button name developmenttype developmentreplace [11]```^buttondevelopment

progressive updates

setup progress: step 1: planning 2: design 3: implementation```buttonname 1type line(2) [x] planning replace [22]```^buttonstep1```buttonname line(3) design [33]```^buttonstep2```buttonname 3type line(4) implementation [44] ```^buttonstep3

replace chain buttons

combine functionality href="/usage/types/chain">chain buttons:

## dashboardstatus: loadinglast update: nevernotes: refresh dashboardtype chainactions [ {"type": "line(2) text" "action": "status: updated "} "line(3) "last tpdatenow('hh:mm') %>"} "line(4) "notes: dashboard refreshed"}]replace [24]templater true```^buttonrefresh

replace counting

how numbers work

  • lines are counted top starting 1
  • empty count lines
  • containing codeblock its id lines
  • headers bullet points all individual lines

example numbers

1 note2 3 unknown  34 progress: 0% 4 5 check: never 567 ```button8 name all9 type text10 action complete11 100%12 tpdatenow() %>13 [35]14 templater true15 ```16 ^buttonupdate

replace best practices

planning strategy

  • identify stable sections: changes regularly
  • preserve structure: keep headers structure intact
  • use templates: combine templates consistent updates
  • test numbers: carefully avoid wrong content

content organization

  • dedicated create specifically replaced content
  • clear boundaries: use separators replaceable areas
  • consistent formatting: maintain reliable replacement

error prevention

  • count twice: doublecheck before deployment
  • use comments: add invisible comments boundaries
  • test incrementally: start small ranges expand

common cases

status dashboards

  • project updates
  • task completion tracking
  • system health monitoring
  • progress indicators

dynamic content

  • weather information
  • date/time stamps
  • calculated values
  • external integration

configuration management

  • settings updates
  • environment switching
  • feature flags
  • parameter adjustment

troubleshooting replace

wrong replaced: verify counting empty blocks lines

replace working: check exist within bounds

content corruption: always test operations copies first

line change: added/removed above section shift

replace mutations provide precise control over updates enabling sophisticated workflows where notes can dynamically refreshed while preserving surrounding context structure

/usage/types/swap.html.title: Swap Buttons
/usage/types/swap.html.content:
swap buttons are special < href="/usage/inline">inline buttons that cycle through multiple other buttons with each click they’re perfect creating toggles multistate controls workflows where need perform different actions sequence

how swap work

button references by their ids time click button executes next sequence cycling back first after reaching last

creating buttons

step 1: create action buttons

first individual will through:

```buttonname show detailstype append textaction ## project details status: active owner: john doe due date: friday```^buttonshowdetails```buttonname hide removeaction details active friday```^buttonhidedetails

step 2: button

create buttons:

```buttonname toggle swapswap [showdetails hidedetails]```^buttontoggledetails

step 3: use inline button

swap can only used buttons:

project info toggle: `buttontoggledetails`

swap examples

simple toggle

```buttonname start timertype  timer started <% tpdatenow("hh:mm") %>templater true```^buttonstarttimer```buttonname stop type  stopped true```^buttonstoptimer```buttonname toggletype [starttimer stoptimer]```^buttontimertoggleusage: `buttontimertoggle`

multistate workflow

```buttonname plan projecttype planning  [ ] define requirements timeline```^buttonplan```button name developmenttype development  [x] complete implementation```^buttondevelop```buttonname deploy deployed  monitoring```^buttondeploy```buttonname workflowtype [plan develop deploy]```^buttonprojectworkflowproject `buttonprojectworkflow`

mode switcher

```buttonname modetype line(1) environment: replace [11]```^buttondevmode```buttonname testing text action  replace [11]```^buttontestmode```buttonname production replace [11]```^buttonprodmode```buttonname environment switchertype [devmode testmode prodmode]```^buttonenvswitchenvironment: unknownswitch mode: `buttonenvswitch`

advanced examples

task state manager

```buttonname mark todotype line(2) complete reportreplace [22]```^buttontodo```buttonname progresstype [/] report ( progress)replace [22] ```^buttonprogress```buttonname completetype replace [22]```^buttoncomplete```buttonname task [todo progress complete]```^buttontasktoggle## list reporttoggle state: `buttontasktoggle`

daily mood tracker

```buttonname good moodtype line(3) mood:  goodreplace [33]```^buttongood```buttonname neutral  replace [33]```^buttonneutral```buttonname bad  badreplace [33]```^buttonbad```buttonname trackertype [good neutral bad]```^buttonmoodtracker## daily checkdate: tpdatenow("yyyymmdd") %>mood: setupdate `buttonmoodtracker`

swap features

cycle behavior

  • sequential: execute order listed swap array
  • circular: last cycles first
  • reset note reload: position resets when close reopen note

state independence

each sequence independent:

  • different types (command text template etc)
  • different styling colors
  • different href="/usage/mutations">mutations (remove replace)
  • different href="/usage/templater">templater settings

inline restriction

swap buttons:

  • must reference id button prefix
  • cannot clicked directly from codeblock
  • work perfectly href="/usage">live preview mode

swap best practices

design considerations

  • clear indication: make obvious which currently active
  • logical progression: natural sequence
  • visual consistency: similar related buttons

state management

  • predictable behavior: users should understand what
  • reset strategies: consider how affect user experience
  • documentation: label clearly indicate purpose

common patterns

  • toggle: twostate / switches
  • cycle: progression (todo progress complete)
  • mode switching: operational modes
  • view states: show/hide information

creating complex workflows

multifeature dashboard

```buttonname overviewtype prepend templateaction overview templatereplace [310]```^buttonoverview```buttonname [310]```^buttondetails```buttonname analyticstype analytics [310]```^buttonanalytics```buttonname dashboard viewtype [overview details analytics]```^buttondashboard# dashboardcurrent view: defaultcontent appear hereswitch `buttondashboard`

seasonal planning

```buttonname spring planstype  garden preparation cleaning```^buttonspring```button summer  vacation planning outdoor activities```^buttonsummer```buttonname fall  harvest season holiday preparation ```^buttonfall```buttonname winter  celebrations indoor projects```^buttonwinter```buttonname seasonal plannertype [spring summer fall winter]```^buttonseasonalplan season: `buttonseasonal`

troubleshooting buttons

swap working: ensure ’re using prefix

wrong executing: check ids array match actual codeblock ids

swap unexpectedly: this normal behavior note

button cycling: verify all referenced exist have valid ids

swap provide elegant way interactive stateful elements your notes enabling sophisticated while maintaining clean uncluttered interface
